title: Sri Lanka requests proposals for legal, financial advisors for debt, IMF
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Finance Ministry has requested proposals from legal and financial advisors to help with debt restructuring negotiations and discussions with the International Monetary Fund.
The financial advisor will have to help with debt management, evaluating government debt position, helping with negotiating with credits and arranging meetings.
The legal advisor will negotiate and represent Sri Lanka at creditor meetings.
The legal advisor will work in consultation with the financial advisor and other agencies.
